description: Guess the answers to the following questions.

dialogs.answer: The process of loading small programs by which your computer becomes operational is called booting.

dialogs.text: What are the most important small programs in an OS?
dialogs.answer: The most important small programs in an OS are IO.SYS and MSDOS.SYS which are called system files and COMMAND.COM is a command interpreter.

dialogs.text: In what ways can you boot your computer?
dialogs.answer:
You can boot the computer in two ways. They are:

1. Cold Boot

2. Warm Boot

dialogs.text: What does the computer first when it cool boots?
dialogs.answer: When you switch on the computer from its off state then the computer performs different self tests such as it checks the display, hardware and then checks for the free space in the memory (RAM).

dialogs.text: When a computer cool boots, when does it start searching for the system files in different locations like your floppy disk or hard disk or CD-ROM?
dialogs.answer: As soon as it reads the free space.

dialogs.text: What happens when the computer can't find the system files?
dialogs.answer: Then the operating system won't be loaded in your computer.
The process of transferring system files into the working memory of computer and making it ready to work is known as Cold Boot.

dialogs.text: When you press _____ together then the contents in the memory (RAM) will be cleared and the system files will be again searched and loaded into the memory.

dialogs.answer: When the computer needs to restart under software control without switching off power, it is known as Warm Booting.

dialogs.text: If you want to turn off the power and boot it again, what kind of booting is done? (Warm booting/Cold booting)

title: Booting
